item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Anthony Edwards
item.description: "Be what you are. Don't change yourself for anything. God made you that way for a reason." -- Anthony Edwards

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Judy Garland
item.description: "Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." -- Judy Garland

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "It's that wonderful old-fashioned idea that others come first and you come second. This was the whole ethic by which I was brought up. Others matter more than you do, so 'don't fuss, dear; get on with it'." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "A woman who doesn't wear perfume has no future." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens" -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by William James
item.description: "The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook." -- William James

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Anthony Robbins
item.description: "I've come to believe that all my past failure and frustration were actually laying the foundation for the understandings that have created the new level of living I now enjoy. " -- Anthony Robbins

item.title: -Marisa add a quote by Euripides
item.description: "Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect." -- Euripides
